page.title: 20Alfred Leslie Rowse
page.content: A.L.Rowse is the most famous historian,poet and scholar,Cornwall has ever known.He was born in St.Austell,in 1903,and was educated at St.Austell elementary & grammar schools ,and at Christchurch,Oxford. He won a fellowship in history at "All Souls" and became a fellow of the "Royal Society for Literature".He also became President of the English Association in 1952,and Trevelyan lecturer at Cambridge.He is the foremost Cornish writer of the day,and also a great Elizabethian scholar as proved, for example by his books 'Tudor Cornwall','Sir Richard Grenville'&'Raleigh and the Throgmortons'some of his other great books are 'A Cornish Childhood'&'A Cornish Man at Oxford':his volumes of essays and verse,indicate his great gift as a man of letters.
